#Text=Be Your Dog 's Best Friend
#Text=( Monks of New Skete Method )
#Text=The Monks of New Skete are widely respected for their work with German Shepherd dogs .
#Text=This article will summarize their advice , but to apply their principles it 's best to read the book .
#Text=Steps
#Text=See your dog as a reflection of yourself .
#Text=This is not required , but it does shed light on how the monks view and treat their dogs .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=On a deeper level , when we pay close attention , dogs mirror us back to ourselves in unmistakable ways that , if we are open , foster understanding and change .

_	_	_	_

#Text= You ca n't become a better trainer without becoming a better human being . "

column1: #Text=Create a genuinely positive , encouraging attitude whenever you work with your dog .
#Text=Dogs are very perceptive and will pick up on your negative emotions .
#Text=Before training your dog , take a few deep breaths and clear your mind .
#Text=Visualize the training session you 're about to have with your dog .
#Text=When you feel calm and ready , proceed .
#Text=Include your dog in your life on as many different levels as possible .
#Text=Use eye contact to communicate .
#Text=Use gentle looks to foster acceptance and trust .
#Text=Use piercing and sustained eye contact when your dog has done something it should not do , and knows it should not do ( such as snapping at strangers ) .
#Text=Approach training holistically .
#Text=It 's not just a set of exercises contained within sessions , though that is important .
#Text=Understand your dog 's roots .
#Text=Learn about wolf behavior .
#Text=Investigate the breed of your dog , and what that breed was intended to do .
#Text=Use praise as a foundation , not just as a reward .
#Text=Many people use praise to " bribe " their dog , and that 's something a dog can easily see through .
#Text=Praise your dog generously and genuinely .
#Text=Find out what kind of praise animates your dog ; experiment !
#Text=Use both physical and verbal praise .
#Text="

_	_	_	_

#Text=Praise is an attitude , a stance .
